info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:04AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Saline River Near Rye affecting Bradley, Ashley, Drew and Cleveland Counties.
For the Saline River...including Rye...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Saline River near Rye.
* WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Railroad Bridge across the river east of Warren effected. State Highway 8 in Eastern Bradley County may be flooded. State Highway 8 Bridge at Longview between Ashley and Bradley counties and numerous county roads along the river flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday evening and continue rising to 29.5 feet early Friday morning. This is based off of future rainfall. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for updates. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 72 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1115 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Ashley, AR; Bradley, AR; Cleveland, AR; Drew, AR
